title: CryptoCloaks
author: CryptoCloaks
content: Hey everyone!We just started our Custom 3D Printing service where we will 3D print anything you need. If you have an STL or file you want printed we'll do it!Visit 3dprintmystl.com!It's easy.Upload you file and submit your order!We will reach out and grab the needed info to print whatever you’d like!PLA / PETG Price = $3 per hour of print time + ShippingMAX PRINT SIZE: 25×21×21 cm (9.84″×8.3″×8.3″)Disclaimer: We will not print your guns. That’s a federal offense and we’re not going to go to prison. Please do not send those orders in. If we receive one, the order will be deleted.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: @CryptoCloaks Just wondering are you shipping from United States and to what countries exactly?I already ordered and printed some stuff locally, but I wanted to see how much you would charge and maybe test Bitcoin or LN payments. There is something little confusing I found in you About page, stating only countries you shipped written below, with some that don't even exist (I think), for example country Reunion, Republic. Lativa and Austrilia... so you might want to correct this  QuoteUnited States, Japan, Austrailia, Germany, Mexico, Canada, China, Switzerland, UK, France, Norway, Romania, Slovenia, Ireland, Czech, Republic, Reunion, The Netherlands, Thailand, Lativa, Poland, Israel, Spain.https://www.cryptocloaks.com/aboutus/

comments.author: CryptoCloaks
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on July 10, 2022, 05:39:08 PM@CryptoCloaks Just wondering are you shipping from United States and to what countries exactly?I already ordered and printed some stuff locally, but I wanted to see how much you would charge and maybe test Bitcoin or LN payments. There is something little confusing I found in you About page, stating only countries you shipped written below, with some that don't even exist (I think), for example country Reunion, Republic. Lativa and Austrilia... so you might want to correct this  QuoteUnited States, Japan, Austrailia, Germany, Mexico, Canada, China, Switzerland, UK, France, Norway, Romania, Slovenia, Ireland, Czech, Republic, Reunion, The Netherlands, Thailand, Lativa, Poland, Israel, Spain.https://www.cryptocloaks.com/aboutus/Hey!So we ship world wide from the US and also have a location we can ship from the UK to reduce shipping cost.So those countries are all ones we have shipped to in the past, and yes those are all real countries hahaha.Prices will vary depending on print time, but if you send me over a file I could give you an estimate.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoCloaks on July 10, 2022, 07:19:54 PMand yes those are all real countries hahaha.Those would be real countries if your punctuation and spelling would be correct. But it's not.With such mistakes and carelessness I would be afraid to use your services: I don't know where would you actually send the printed item.

comments.author: CryptoCloaks
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on July 11, 2022, 09:16:33 AMQuote from: CryptoCloaks on July 10, 2022, 07:19:54 PMand yes those are all real countries hahaha.Those would be real countries if your punctuation and spelling would be correct. But it's not.With such mistakes and carelessness I would be afraid to use your services: I don't know where would you actually send the printed item.I'm sorry you feel that way.We have sent packages worldwide and have been running for 6 years without any issues. We're more worried about quality parts than grammar.

comments.author: CryptoCloaks
comments.body: Fixed the major spelling and grammar issues for those who were worried and brought it to our attention. Thank you for your concern."Countries we have sent to:United States, Japan, Australia, Germany, Mexico, Canada, China, Switzerland, UK, France, Norway, Romania, Slovenia, Ireland, Czech, Reunion, The Netherlands, Thailand, Latvia, Poland, Israel, Spain."For those confused. These are countries we have shipped to in the past as a fun way to track where we've sent packages. We can send anywhere in the world.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on July 11, 2022, 09:16:33 AMQuote from: CryptoCloaks on July 10, 2022, 07:19:54 PMand yes those are all real countries hahaha.Those would be real countries if your punctuation and spelling would be correct. But it's not.With such mistakes and carelessness I would be afraid to use your services: I don't know where would you actually send the printed item.typos on countries they ship to? really? that would cause you not to order? pull your head out man - have issues, ask questions - get answers.There were 4 "typos" pointed out - 2 were spelt wrong, 1 is actually a place and yea 1 was wtf (Republic)My guess is the list was pulled from order addresses in which case the database was most likely populated with those names as the customers wrote them.They send the items to the address that the customer provides.if the answers are bullshit then maybe an issue.There are many people who have ordered from Crypto Cloaks - hell thousands of orders have gone out from them.At that last Bitcoin Conference in Miami, Crypto Cloaks was there and was printing 24/7 during the several days of the conference handing out everything that was printed during that time for free to conference attendees. I personally work with Crypto Cloaks and print/ship as part of their team and I have shipped out close to 1500 prints that I myself have printed for them.There is no need to worry about whether their orders will make it out or not.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 11, 2022, 01:56:31 PMif the answers are bullshit then maybe an issue.The thing is that when they were asked about the errors.. I found the answer.. let's say unprofessional.Maybe I was too harsh, but imho it has helped them get the point and fix their problem.Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 11, 2022, 01:56:31 PMI personally work with Crypto Cloaks and print/ship as part of their team and I have shipped out close to 1500 prints that I myself have printed for them.This is more reassuring than anything they can say!

comments.author: CryptoCloaks
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on July 11, 2022, 02:03:54 PMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 11, 2022, 01:56:31 PMif the answers are bullshit then maybe an issue.The thing is that when they were asked about the errors.. I found the answer.. let's say unprofessional.Maybe I was too harsh, but imho it has helped them get the point and fix their problem.Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on July 11, 2022, 01:56:31 PMI personally work with Crypto Cloaks and print/ship as part of their team and I have shipped out close to 1500 prints that I myself have printed for them.This is more reassuring than anything they can say!I understand we're newish to the forums but no need to be so harsh. Not everyone's a scammer.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoCloaks on July 11, 2022, 01:37:00 PMFixed the major spelling and grammar issues for those who were worried and brought it to our attention. Thank you for your concern.Nice work.Sorry I had to point that out in public, but I developed that habit after checking out and inspecting many suspicious websites, and many of them had spelling mistakes that was red alert or me.I know you are not a scam, but you might want to check rest of the pages and fix other potential errors.  It looks much more professional especially if English is your native language.PSI see you are not printing guns, but you obviously print bitcoin bombs and hand grenades

comments.author: CryptoCloaks
comments.body: It's all good, thank you for bringing that to our attention in a respectable way! We have no problem fixing errors as things do happen.Bitcoin Grenades over guns!
